intro: Chaenactis pedicularia, commonly known as the slender paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
